samples.context: Companion cells are thin walled elongated specialized Parenchyma cells. They are associated with sieve elements. They have a prominent nucleus and cytoplasm.
samples.question: What are companion cells associated with?

samples.context: Companion cells are thin walled elongated specialized Parenchyma cells. They help the sieve tube in conduction of food materials in angiosperms.
samples.question: What is the function of companion cells?

samples.context: Companion cells are thin walled elongated specialized Parenchyma cells. They have a prominent nucleus and cytoplasm. They support the sieve tube in food conduction.
samples.question: What is a notable feature of companion cells?

samples.context: Companion cells are associated with sieve elements. They help the sieve tube in conduction of food materials in angiosperms.
samples.question: What do companion cells assist in?

samples.context: Companion cells are thin walled elongated specialized Parenchyma cells. They help in conduction of food materials in angiosperms.
samples.question: What type of plants are companion cells found in?
